column1: In Ratnayake Vs. C.D. Perera8  the Supreme Court observed that;

column2: “In my view neither the "Lanka Guru Sangamaya" nor the respondents
its officials, are public bodies performing duties of a public nature. The
duties that the petitioners want the three respondents to be compelled
to perform by a Writ of Mandamus are not duties of a public nature for
which  such  a  Writ  will  lie.  They  are  contractual  ditties  outside  the
ambit of Mandamus.”

column1: Furthermore, Wade in his text 'Administrative Law' 4th Edition, page 603

column2: “the Court does not issue a Writ of Mandamus in a case in which the
right  which  the  petitioner  wants  to  enforce  is  based  on  a  contract.
Contractual  duties  are  enforceable  as  a  matter  of  private  law  by
ordinary  contractual  remedies,  such  as  damages,  injunctions  and
specific  performance.  Duties  enforceable  by  Mandamus  are  those
imposed by law."
